channel.title: Cruel, community member?
channel.description: Heh, I know it's kind of unusual, but Cruel is a really great coder, has a great understanding of the windows API, codes in several languages, etc... I think he deserves to be a community member here, though the rep system isn't exactly perfect, so at this rate it will take some time before he does become one... ... Discuss?... Vote? (Don't flame me please :P)

item.title: Cruel, community member?
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Everyone hated me back then :’( lol

And since it came up, you can get Windows to force a redraw of off-screen applets.
And @ psb, we know how to send mouse events lol… it’s creating a fake window focus beforehand that’s the hard part (at least without client modding). I never figured out a stable solution and gave it up. But it would be cool if I could figure that out… then I could make much better things than a resizable client like in the vid ^^, not to mention the ability to autoing on a covered RS applet.

anyhow, cheers to freddy
and those who repped me

Read full topic

item.title: Cruel, community member?
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:18, topic:78866”][quote author=RLN link=topic=115764.msg1150168#msg1150168 date=1176509885]
I don’t think it can be done, does the graphics object even paint when its not visible? I’m pretty sure you’d have to force the applet to paint, somehow… but if you were hacking the client anyway you would just retrieve the Canvas?
[/quote]

Sure, my one idea is printing the canvas to a bitmap and having SCAR read from that, but it seems like there should be a less messy, more efficient way to do things.[/quote]
I would think that would be really slow -.-

I don’t know Cruel, but the only one I’d suggest to be CM right now would be lawl, apart from his crappy attitude/slang he does have a vast knowledge of java.

Though, if they really do deserve it they will get enough rep to get to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Cruel, community member?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

According to many archived threads I’ve come across, it uses the PrintWindow API, though it only works for covered windows (or not covered ones), but not minimized…
However, applets just show up as an empty spot…
The only resource on it rly is:
http://www.fengyuan.com/article/wmprint.html
It explains how to hook the window in c++, but I don’t understand it…
(Since I’m not into c++ besides knowing some basics )

Read full topic

I don’t know the whole story though, I know how it works, but it needs some mofiying for java applets cuz sun java is so messy :)[/quote]

item.title: Cruel, community member?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

RLN:

He could very well have googled something like “visual basic bezier curve” and found the code. I’m not saying he did, and I don’t know much about him… but I don’t think one single post should define whether he is a CM. I think if he deserves CM, he will get the required rep

Actually, the vb source he released is just a conversion of his original delphi source
And a single post indeed doesn’t define anything, BUT he’s been releasing code and helping people learn programmining langauges and such for ages…
Without cruel I wouldn’t even be a coder today

The Un-Named:

Yes, I remember him mentioning he could get colors from a window even if it was covered, although I was only on this forum at the time I didn’t see the end result of it.

He can indeed easilly do that
I don’t know the whole story though, I know how it works, but it needs some mofiying for java applets cuz sun java is so messy

item.title: Cruel, community member?
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Lol it’s not hard, especially in c++; even more so when done with direct x; but gdi wrappers work well too.

and simulated mouse events and key events are relatively easy too; actually they’re pretty incredible as far as ease is concerned.

[code]
void Bot::mouseClick(int x, int y, char button)
{
SetCursorPos(x, y);

if (button == 'l')
{
  mouse_event(MOUSEEVENTF_LEFTDOWN, x, y, 0, 0);
    mouse_event(MOUSEEVENTF_LEFTUP, x, y, 0, 0);
}

else if (button == 'r')
{
    mouse_event(MOUSEEVENTF_RIGHTDOWN, x, y, 0, 0);
    mouse_event(MOUSEEVENTF_RIGHTUP, x, y, 0, 0);
}
Sleep(100);

}[/code]

Note that this isn’t taken from any of my projects but from EON.

Read full topic
